Calculate Renal Function Category

Source: R/calculations.R
calculate_rfcat.Rd

Calculate Renal Function Category (RFCAT)

Usage

calculate_rfcat(egfr)

Arguments

egfr

Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (mL/min/1.73m^2). Numeric vector.

Value

This function returns a numeric vector the same length as its inputs

Details

Formula to calculate RFCAT:
  1 = Normal Function (>= 90 mL/min)
  2 = Mild Impairment (60-89 mL/min)
  3 = Moderate Impairment (30-59 mL/min)
  4 = Severe Impairment (15-29 mL/min)
  5 = End Stage Disease (< 15 mL/min or Dialysis)

References

Guidance for Industry: Pharmacokinetics in Patients with Impaired Renal Function — Study Design, Data Analysis, and Impact on Dosing and Labeling

Examples

library(dplyr)

dmcognigen_cov %>% 
  mutate(RFCAT = calculate_rfcat(EGFR))
#> Formula to calculate RFCAT: 
#>   1 = Normal Function (>= 90 mL/min)
#>   2 = Mild Impairment (60-89 mL/min)
#>   3 = Moderate Impairment (30-59 mL/min)
#>   4 = Severe Impairment (15-29 mL/min)
#>   5 = End Stage Disease (< 15 mL/min or Dialysis)

# Below will also work if the dataset contains expected variables
dmcognigen_cov %>% 
  mutate(RFCAT = calculate_rfcat())
#> EGFR variable found and used for the egfr argument.
#> Formula to calculate RFCAT: 
#>   1 = Normal Function (>= 90 mL/min)
